response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age (19 years old)", "high", "Young age is associated with a higher likelihood of recidivism due to developmental influences and risk-taking behavior."],
    ["Race (identifies as Black)", "medium", "While race itself is not causative, systemic and community-level factors might moderately influence risk due to potential social disadvantages."],
    ["Arrest History (1 arrest, no conviction)", "medium", "A prior arrest, even without conviction, may indicate minor prior involvement with law enforcement, contributing moderately to risk."],
    ["Living Situation (living alone, never married)", "medium", "Social isolation can reduce community and familial support, moderately elevating risk."],
    ["Educational/Occupational Status (high school diploma, not in college, 1 job held)", "medium", "Limited educational and employment engagement can correlate with fewer structured opportunities, moderately increasing recidivism risk."],
    ["Substance Use (no drug use in past four years)", "low", "Absence of recent drug use is a protective factor and lowers risk."],
    ["Mental Health (persistent feelings of being down)", "high", "Extended periods of depressive mood can impair judgment and increase vulnerability, thereby significantly raising risk."],
    ["Early Household Environment (lived with biological mother in an urban setting)", "medium", "An urban upbringing and small household may present both challenges and support, offering a moderate influence on later risk."],
    ["Religious Belief (views God as influential)", "low", "A belief in a higher power can provide social and personal support, functioning as a protective factor and lowering risk."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 70
}

risk_factors: Young age is associated with a higher likelihood of recidivism due to developmental influences and risk-taking behavior.
While race itself is not causative, systemic and community-level factors might moderately influence risk due to potential social disadvantages.
A prior arrest, even without conviction, may indicate minor prior involvement with law enforcement, contributing moderately to risk.
Social isolation can reduce community and familial support, moderately elevating risk.
Educational/Occupational Status (high school diploma, not in college, 1 job held)
Limited educational and employment engagement can correlate with fewer structured opportunities, moderately increasing recidivism risk.
Substance Use (no drug use in past four years)
Absence of recent drug use is a protective factor and lowers risk.
Mental Health (persistent feelings of being down)
Extended periods of depressive mood can impair judgment and increase vulnerability, thereby significantly raising risk.
Early Household Environment (lived with biological mother in an urban setting)
An urban upbringing and small household may present both challenges and support, offering a moderate influence on later risk.
A belief in a higher power can provide social and personal support, functioning as a protective factor and lowering risk.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 19-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 1 time but has not been convicted. He is 5 feet 8 inches and weighs 145 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is not enrolled in college. He has held 1 job during the year. He has not used any drugs in the past four years and most of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 3, in an urban area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
